16:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Classified Stakes (Div I)

runners.comment: Blow hot and cold and his losing run stands at 28; obvious chance if near best; 7f a query
runners.name: Call Glory
runners.spotlight: Regressive 5yo; penultimate second at Newcastle (6f) would give him strong claims but he typically failed to back it up last time; drops into his first 0-50 classified race and will surely never get a better chance to end his losing run; on the downside, his stamina for 7f still isn't assured; declared 2.30 Southwell Sunday.

runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but ran well over 8.6f here last month; one to consider in this field
runners.name: Dash Power
runners.spotlight: Poor strike-rate but he ran well over 8.6f here on his penultimate start; not so good at Southwell last time but that was a stronger race than this; more appealing than some.

runners.comment: C&D winner; ages since last win but can't be ruled out here after some good runs in 2025
runners.name: Eye Of The Water
runners.spotlight: C&D winner; drawn a blank since August 2023 but there were enough good runs in 2025 to bring him right into the picture at this level.

runners.comment: Achieved little but there was a hint of ability last spring; market useful down in grade
runners.name: For What Its Worth
runners.spotlight: Low-level form in three novice/maiden runs but there was a hint of promise; not beaten a rival in either handicap run (6f and 7f) but last time was after a break and he drops into a classified event in new headgear; worth a market check in such a weak contest.

runners.comment: Low mileage but modest form and cheekpieces didn't help last time
runners.name: Mishys Star
runners.spotlight: Glimmer of promise on second handicap start, over 7f at Chelmsford in November, but no progress upped to 1m at Lingfield four weeks ago (cheekpieces first time, retained); others appeal more.

runners.comment: Exposed 14-race maiden; likely best watched after a four-month break
runners.name: Oldbury Lad
runners.spotlight: Exposed 14-race maiden; absent for four months and not at his best on either AW run; likely best watched.

runners.comment: Has run well over C&D but he needs to bounce back from a quiet 5f run last week
runners.name: Under Curfew
runners.spotlight: Yet to win over this trip but did finish second over C&D in September 2024; some fair 5f runs this winter but last week's Newcastle effort wasn't one of them.

runners.comment: Three 1m wins in 2024 but not so good last year; too much to prove
runners.name: United Force
runners.spotlight: Three wins at 1m in 2024; not so good last year and he was never going well on his latest start (after a 133-day break); too much to prove.

16:30.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Classified Stakes (Div II)

runners.comment: Course winner; in and out last year but best efforts would give her a squeak at this level
runners.name: American Rose
runners.spotlight: Generally below her best last year but there was the odd good effort along the way and today's conditions won't faze her; not discounted after a short break.

runners.comment: Two wins last year, including here (9.5f); out of sorts when last seen; not a solid option
runners.name: Anificas Beauty
runners.spotlight: Won twice last year, a 1m handicap at Pontefract and a classified event over 9.5f here; out of sorts when last seen though and not a solid option back from 112 days off.

runners.comment: 16-race maiden; drops into his first 0-50 classified and can't be discounted
runners.name: Captain Pickles
runners.spotlight: 16-race maiden who has flattered to deceive on occasion; returns from an 11-week break in his first 0-50 classified race; not discounted.

runners.comment: C&D winner; shaped with promise here five weeks ago; each-way claims at least
runners.name: Evoluir
runners.spotlight: C&D winner last February; shaped with promise over C&D five weeks ago and if he can build on that then he can play a part in the finish.

runners.comment: Second in a C&D handicap last month; not so good last time but this is weaker
runners.name: Kodebreaker
runners.spotlight: Failed to win in 2025 but he was second in a C&D handicap on his penultimate start; only midfield at Southwell since but this looks easier and he can't be dismissed.

runners.comment: Hard to win with and he returns from a break over a trip that looks sharp enough
runners.name: Mr Trick
runners.spotlight: Over two years since the last of his three wins; ended 2025 quietly and he returns from a 146-day break over a trip that is probably sharp enough for him now.

runners.comment: Course winner (6f); running okay of late but needs the step back up in trip to spark extra
runners.name: Rogue Thunder
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 with a 6f win here; recent efforts haven't been too bad but hopes rest on the return to 7f sparking something extra.

runners.comment: Quiet on last three starts but drops into a 0-50 classified & a revival not impossible
runners.name: The Gay Blade
runners.spotlight: Failed to win in 2025 and he has been well short of his best on his last three starts; drops in grade here though and a revival wouldn't be a major surprise.

17:00.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Classified Stakes (Div III)

runners.breeder: David John Brown & Whistbury Manor Stud
runners.comment: 0-17 but was good second in a Southwell handicap (7f) last time; key player
runners.name: Aim For The Bull
runners.spotlight: 0-17 but he's finished runner-up in three of his last six starts including in a Southwell handicap (7f, Tapeta) last month; should go well again back in a classified event and he's a key player.

runners.comment: Just 1-42 but he's a big player on his best form last winter; in the mix back in trip
runners.name: Al Baahy
runners.spotlight: Just one win from 42 starts but he's run respectably in Tapeta handicaps in last two runs and is a big player on his best form last winter; seems tactically versatile and he's in the mix back in trip.

runners.breeder: Manister House, N Anderton & P Leonard
runners.comment: Most of her wins have been at 6f and losing run is up to 15; others preferred
runners.name: Catherine Chroi
runners.spotlight: Won six times in 2024 but she was 0-15 last year and was well held at Newcastle (7f, Tapeta) last month; needs to raise her game and most of her wins have been at 6f.

runners.comment: Sole win was as a 2yo and he was regressive last year; opposable on return
runners.name: Magic Fluke
runners.spotlight: Sole win from 24 starts was as a 2yo in November 2023; was much better than this level in his youth but he generally struggled last year and was tailed off at Chelmsford (7f, AW) when last seen in October; headgear is now removed and has lots to prove on his return.

runners.comment: Overall record of 1-47 and has tough task at the weights on comeback for new yard
runners.name: Musaytir
runners.spotlight: Overall record of 1-47 and has not finished closer than sixth in his last 18 runs; returns for new yard after 553 days off and can only be watched.

runners.comment: Eight-race maiden who has not progressed and she needs a transformation back in trip
runners.name: Straight Back Up
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden who has not progressed and was ninth of ten in a Lingfield handicap (1m; first-time hood) last month; took a strong hold in that race but she needs a transformation back in trip.

runners.comment: Has work to do on these terms but this drop back in trip looks a positive; not ruled out
runners.name: Supernova Steps
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-18 but her win came on Tapeta and she ran well for a long way over 8.6f here last Saturday; has some work to do on these terms but this drop back in trip looks a positive and she could be dangerous.

runners.comment: Won at Kempton last month and he didn't get any luck at Lingfield last time; interesting
runners.name: Vitalline
runners.spotlight: Six-time AW winner who scored at Kempton (6f) on his penultimate run and didn't get much luck when strong-finishing fifth under a penalty at Lingfield (7f) two weeks ago; could be a big factor if he gets the breaks this time and he's an interesting contender back in a classified event.

17:30.race_name: Win £250,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Restricted Novice Stakes (Horses In Bands B, C And D) (GBB)

runners.comment: Group-race form in Germany but ran to a low level in two runs for M Botti last autumn
runners.name: Abando
runners.spotlight: Had Group-race form in Germany but he was disappointing in two runs for Marco Botti last autumn; has changed stable since last seen (same owner) and if he runs anywhere close to his BHA mark of 90 then he'll be hard to beat; does have a point to prove dropping back in trip though.

runners.comment: Some promise in 2 runs for A Balding early in 2025; makes stable debut after 297 days off
runners.name: Daddy Chill
runners.spotlight: Remote third on his Chelmsford debut last February; better run when fourth of seven at Southwell the following month; absent 297 days and now starts out for a new stable (still owned by former trainer).

runners.comment: Tailed off in two bumpers and a 9.5f novice here; no appeal
runners.name: Miss Helena
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in two bumpers and a 9.5f novice here; no appeal.

runners.comment: Runner-up in both starts last month; capable of better and more appealing than most
runners.name: Alba Gu Brath
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut at Kempton last month (1m) and sent off the odds-on favourite for a 1m novice at Newcastle ten days later; helped force a good pace on that occasion but was left trailing by an impressive newcomer in the final 2f; more appealing than most.

runners.comment: 4th different trip in 4 starts; has hinted at ability but stamina has to be taken on trust
runners.name: Five Cay
runners.spotlight: Having his fourth run of the winter and over his fourth different trip; 5f was too sharp ten days ago but his stamina for this trip has to be taken on trust (stamina on bottom line of his pedigree but he's by Ardad).

runners.comment: No impact in two 7f runs last year; up in trip with headgear experiment aborted
runners.name: Madjid
runners.owner: Dr Jamal Ahmadzadeh & Mrs D Swinburn
runners.spotlight: No impact in two runs last year (7f, good to firm and Polytrack); hood worn last time is absent today; new trip not enough to tempt.

runners.comment: 200-1 and beaten a long way in two AW runs (including C&D) last year
runners.name: Nandos Pride
runners.owner: S & A Mares And Gentech Products
runners.spotlight: 200-1 and beaten a long way in two AW runs (including C&D) last year.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two runs over 7f last month; unlikely to be of interest until handicapping
runners.name: Big Moonrise
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in two runs over 7f last month; unlikely to be of interest until handicapping.

runners.comment: Put in a good final-furlong effort on debut and she is open to plenty of improvement
runners.name: Poor Relation
runners.spotlight: 50-1 for her Lingfield debut (1m) three weeks ago, a race where she made some headway in the final furlong having been in need of the experience; open to improvement.

runners.comment: Dropped away having raced prominently in two runs in 1m fillies' events last year
runners.name: Very Demure
runners.spotlight: Dropped away having raced prominently in two runs in 1m fillies' events last year; minor handicaps beckon.

18:00.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Novice Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Well-bred newcomer who starts out at a realistic level; could be the answer
runners.name: Asia Force
runners.spotlight: By Frankel and the second foal of a 1m/1m2f winner (including Listed; RPR 107); lots to like on paper and he doesn't face a daunting standard on debut; may be the answer.

runners.comment: Well-held third behind smart prospect on Kempton debut (1m); should do much better in time
runners.name: Genuine Warrior
runners.spotlight: In need of the experience when third behind an exciting prospect at Kempton last month (1m); ended up well beaten in a steadily-run affair but he should know more today and moving up in distance will suit.

runners.breeder: Paget Blds / Chelsea Blds / Charue Inv
runners.comment: Both runs last month offered hope of better; not discounted upped in trip
runners.name: Inherent Resolve
runners.spotlight: Debut effort wasn't without promise and he ran better than the distance beaten might suggest at Chelmsford last month (forced a strong early pace); still open to further progress.

runners.comment: Second run was a good step forward and this longer trip will suit; capable of better
runners.name: Level Look
runners.spotlight: Second run was much better than his debut, belying 200-1 odds when finishing fourth of 12 at Lingfield a fortnight ago (1m); longer trip will suit; capable of better.

runners.breeder: J Hanly, A Stroud And T Stewart
runners.comment: Better effort when 2nd of 8 on last month's AW debut (1m2f); sets standard; new headgear
runners.name: New Bay Star
runners.spotlight: Promise on turf in the autumn and he showed improved form when second of eight at Chelmsford on last month's AW debut (1m2f; first run since a gelding operation); sets the standard on that run; cheekpieces now added.

runners.comment: Big prices and well held in two 1m AW runs last year; new trip not enough to tempt
runners.name: Al Amirah
runners.spotlight: Big prices and well held in two AW runs (1m) last year; another for whom the longer trip needs to prompt considerable progress.

runners.comment: Similar modest form in two fillies' novice races last month; new trip needs to spark extra
runners.name: Angry Ant
runners.spotlight: Similar form in two fillies' novice events last month (7f and 1m); new trip needs to spark extra.

18:30.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Left Ed Walker for 32,000gns after Southwell win in October; respected on stable debut
runners.name: Mollie Foster
runners.spotlight: Added to her turf win when swooping late to score on AW debut at Southwell (1m; off 4lb lower) in October; left Ed Walker for 32,000gns since; still looks feasibly treated on her best form and needs a close look on first run for new connections.

runners.comment: Six-time Tapeta winner who scored in smooth style here last time; big player again up 6lb
runners.name: Enola Grey
runners.spotlight: Hold-up performer who is 1-17 on turf but she recorded her sixth Tapeta win when scoring over 7f here three weeks ago; up 6lb but that was smooth success and this step back up in trip is no problem; big player.

runners.comment: 0-9 for current yard and she struggled at Newcastle on Thursday; needs to bounce back
runners.name: Donna Nook
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f Dundalk maiden (AW) for previous trainer but she's 0-9 for current yard; well treated on her best form last year but she struggled at Newcastle (1m, Tapeta) on Thursday and needs to bounce back on this quick turnaround; first-time visor replaces cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo who won a C&D novice in November; respected on handicap debut
runners.name: Great Mates
runners.spotlight: 4yo who got off the mark when justifying favouritism in a C&D novice in November; that was a good opportunity and this is tougher on handicap debut but she's still unexposed and should have more to offer; in the mix.

runners.comment: Lightly raced 4yo but she's been up and down so far and others are preferred; headgear on
runners.name: Soho Square
runners.spotlight: Newcastle novice winner for James Fanshawe last spring; runner-up in Southwell handicap (7f, Tapeta) on stable debut in October but she flopped at Newcastle in her final run last year; still lightly raced and headgear is now added but she's been up and down so far and others are more convincing.

runners.comment: The only winner in the field; solid third over C&D last month; should be involved again
runners.name: Onyeisi
runners.spotlight: The only winner in the field, namely a 1m2f nursery at Chelmsford two months ago, and he ran another solid race when third of eight over C&D 16 days ago; should make another bold bid.

runners.breeder: Aaron Shaw, Paul Shaw & Anthony Shaw
runners.comment: Modest form in three novice/maiden runs; this more suitable but needs improvement
runners.name: Sweet Mabel
runners.owner: E Murchan, K Mcconnell, A & P Shaw
runners.spotlight: 50-1 and bigger for her three novice/maiden runs, the latest over C&D, and she performed to just a modest level; this should be more suitable but not obviously well treated.

runners.comment: Good 2nd over 8.6f here last month (well backed); stamina for new trip not assured
runners.name: Chilliconcarneigh
runners.spotlight: Sent off a strong favourite for a handicap here three weeks ago (8.6f; third run for David Evans) and ran a good race in finishing second of the nine runners; stamina for the extra distance not assured and not certain to confirm those placings with Family Values.

runners.breeder: R F And S D Knipe
runners.comment: Fair run on last week's stable debut but without looking ahead of his mark
runners.name: Trust No One
runners.spotlight: Ran creditably on last week's stable debut here (8.6f) but he will need improvement for the longer trip if he is to make it seventh time lucky.

runners.comment: No impact in three runs at around 1m last autumn; been gelded; up in trip for h'cap debut
runners.name: Just Call Me Mo
runners.spotlight: Huge prices and always in rear in three maiden/novice runs at around 1m last autumn; gelded since and moves up in distance for his handicap debut; bred to stay well but not obviously well treated.

runners.breeder: Moyns Park Estate And Stud Ltd
runners.comment: Bred to be better than this mark; rates a likely big improver up in trip for h'cap debut
runners.name: Montu
runners.spotlight: Down the field in three runs (5f-7f) in late 2025; bred to be much better than this mark, however, and stepping up in trip looks sure to suit; betting revealing on his handicap debut.

runners.comment: Behind two reopposing rivals here (8.6f) last month; needs more for the longer trip
runners.name: Shes Got The Blues
runners.spotlight: Finished behind a couple of reopposing rivals over 8.6f here three weeks ago; needs more for today's longer trip.

runners.comment: Much more promise when a keeping-on fourth over 8.6f here three weeks ago; more to come
runners.name: Family Values
runners.owner: J Sarkar, D Sarkar, O Sarkar & D Sarkar
runners.spotlight: First signs of ability when staying on into fourth over 8.6f here three weeks ago (Chilliconcarneigh second; blinkered first time); she still looked to have a lot of learning to do on that occasion and the best could still be to come.

runners.comment: Poor form in five starts; steps up in trip with plenty to prove
runners.name: Will He Shine
runners.spotlight: Poor form in five starts, including two Class 6 nurseries; steps up 2.5f in distance but with plenty to find.

19:30.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: 6f winner; ran well given how hard he pulled here last week; solid claims dropped to 5f
runners.name: Far Too Fizzy
runners.spotlight: 6f winner on his nursery debut and he did well to finish second over 6f here last week given he took a fierce hold early; should be quick enough for 5f and he's a leading contender in this field.

runners.comment: 0-15 but had surprisingly few chances in handicaps; should go well from the front
runners.name: Havin A Flyer
runners.spotlight: Had 15 runs as a 2yo and still seeks her first win; not many of those runs have been in races where she has had a realistic chance though and she has run well in most of her nursery starts; well drawn to attack and she could take some pegging back.

runners.comment: Didn't run badly on her nursery debut last month; still low mileage and 5f may help
runners.name: Mythical Night
runners.spotlight: Good run at Brighton in August (5.3f, good); absent for 102 days prior to her nursery debut at Chelmsford 25 days ago (6f; cheekpieces first time), a race where she only weakened in the closing stages; could have more to come back at 5f.

runners.comment: Poor form in three quick runs in the summer; more realistic assignment now handicapping
runners.name: Amazon Jungle
runners.spotlight: Poor form in three quick runs in the summer; can't be recommended on that evidence but he is into a weak race for his handicap debut.

runners.comment: 0-13 but she made a promising return at Newcastle last week; can go well back at 5f
runners.name: Auntie Jo
runners.spotlight: 0-13 but she has shown winning potential and made an encouraging return to action at Newcastle on New Year's Day (6f), travelling well but tying up close home; drops back to 5f from a good draw; one to take seriously.

runners.comment: Struggled for new yard but down in the weights and now tried in blinkers; not solid
runners.name: Nordic Games
runners.spotlight: Well beaten in three runs for this yard in October/November (6f, Tapeta); dropped 9lb as a result and he returns to 5f with blinkers enlisted; not solid but a revival wouldn't be a complete bolt from the blue.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and arrives in fair form; drawn wide but not ruled out
runners.name: Sir Benedict
runners.spotlight: Won on turf last September and he has twice finished second, including C&D, from his five subsequent runs; drawn widest but likely to be held up so perhaps it won't be insurmountable.

runners.comment: Prolific AW winner on a dangerous mark; not at his best of late though
runners.name: Sir Rodneyredblood
runners.spotlight: Prolific AW winner who is well treated on form as recent as last September; quiet more recently though and even the inside stall isn't enough to earn him the nod.

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.name: Global Effort
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.comment: Non-runner
runners.name: Kipp Kelly
runners.spotlight: Non-runner.

runners.comment: Conditions to suit and she arrives on the back of two second-place finishes; solid claims
runners.name: Colors Of Freedom
runners.spotlight: Three C&D wins, the most recent last June; largely consistent since, including runner-up finishes over C&D on her last two starts; handy draw and should give it another good go.

runners.comment: Second over C&D last month but not quite in the same form on Friday; new headgear today
runners.name: Sultan Of Oj
runners.spotlight: His mark has bottomed out and there were more encouraging signs when second of ten over C&D last month; unable to back it up here on Friday and now has cheekpieces tried for the first time (has worn a hood and blinkers in the past).

runners.comment: Regressed last year; low-key stable debut recently but dropping in trip should help
runners.name: Inconspicuous
runners.spotlight: Regressed sharply in 2025 and he was well beaten on his stable debut at Lingfield (7f) 18 days ago; dropping back to 5f could help but he is not a solid option.

runners.comment: 19-race maiden; had excuses on last two starts but still easy enough to look elsewhere
runners.name: Rogue Endeavour
runners.spotlight: 19-race maiden; last two runs easy enough to forgive but he still has his share to prove after a break.

runners.comment: Not built on her promising Lingfield run in two starts since; others are more appealing
runners.name: Second Collection
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner down the years and her fourth at Lingfield last month was a promising return; not so good twice since and others are more appealing.
